Detailed Description

SQL DB Base class

The SQL profiler features additional PHP profiling if the xdebug extension is loaded

Author:
Martin Lindhe, 2007

Member Function Documentation

DB_Base-p::escape ( $  q  )  [abstract]

Escapes a string for use in queries

Parameters:
$q is the query to escape
Returns:
the escaped string, taking db-connection locale into account

DB_Base-p::query ( $  q  )  [abstract]

Performs a general query. Should only be used with special commands that don't return anything. Use the other functions for common SQL operations such as select, insert, update, delete Example: LOCK TABLES

Parameters:
$q is the query to execute
Returns:
the result of the query, if anything

DB_Base-p::delete ( $  q  )  [abstract]

Performs a query that does a DELETE Example: DELETE FROM t WHERE id=1

Parameters:
$q is the query to execute
Returns:
the number of rows affected

DB_Base-p::update ( $  q  ) 

Performs a query that does a UPDATE Example: UPDATE t SET n=1

Parameters:
$q is the query to execute
Returns:
the number of rows affected

DB_Base-p::getArray ( $  q  )  [abstract]

Selects data Example: SELECT * FROM t

Parameters:
$q is the query to execute
Returns:
an array with the results, with columns as array indexes

DB_Base-p::getMappedArray ( $  q  )  [abstract]

Selects data Example: SHOW VARIABLES LIKE "%cache%"

Parameters:
$q is the query to execute
Returns:
an array with the results mapped as key => value

DB_Base-p::getNumArray ( $  q  )  [abstract]

Selects data Example: SELECT textRow FROM t

Parameters:
$q is the query to execute
Returns:
an 1-dimensional array with a numeric index

DB_Base-p::getOneRow ( $  q  )  [abstract]

Selects one row of data Example: SELECT * FROM t WHERE id=1 (where id is distinct)

Parameters:
$q is the query to execute
Returns:
one row-result with columns as array indexes

DB_Base-p::getOneItem ( $  q,
$  num = false 
) [abstract]

Selects one column of one row of data Example: SELECT a FROM t WHERE id=1 (where id is distinct)

Parameters:
$q is the query to execute
$num set to true if you expect a numeric response (to return 0 on failure rather than boolean false)
Returns:
one column-result only
